item.title: How do I spawn monsters in a specific spot
item.dc:creator: @pker_franc0 pker franc0
item.description:
@pker_franc0 wrote:

here is how to spawn an npc
1.open autospawn.cfg
2.go to the very bottom and add this above the [ENDOFSPAWNLIST]:
spawn = [npc id] [XCoord] [Ycoord] 0 0 0 0 0 1
did that help?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I spawn monsters in a specific spot

item.title: How do I spawn monsters in a specific spot
item.dc:creator: @Born2kill_92 Liamssword (Born2kill 92)
item.description:
@Born2kill_92 wrote:

autospan.cfg is your friend, use the examples and replace the co-ords with your own.

[quote=“Rykusyn, post:5, topic:103023”]and what do i tpye to do that? like what’s the code?

example… to make abyssal whip, ::pickup 4151 1

[br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2007, 07:00:05 PM[/size][hr]where do i get autospawn.cfg?[br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2007, 07:37:53 PM[/size][hr]can anyone tell me exactly what to type to spawn a lesser demon?[/quote]
Don’t triple post.

item.title: How do I spawn monsters in a specific spot
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Go into your autospawn.cfg . Type the layout that goes with the others. There are coordinates in which you can place your NPC where ever you wish.

item.title: How do I spawn monsters in a specific spot
item.dc:creator: @sic_pure sic pure
item.description:
@sic_pure wrote:

Type ::npc (NPC id here) example: ::npc 1 spawns 1 man NPC.

Read full topic
